content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												Okay, this game, I can assure you that it's not for all. But for people who just want to have a little fun one late night can pick it up with a friend or two, and suddenly it's so much better. I'll point out a few pros and cons about it (that I know of, and personally think is good/bad) because a lot of people think this is the best♥♥♥♥♥♥ever. It is not. There are many games better than this. But anyway.. What this game has to offer is:- Good soundtrack. Of course not all the songs appeal to me, but most of them do, and you can just have them in the background while working on something else. IF you buy the soundtrack that is. Not all the songs are available though.- A lot of car customizations. Even without the very neat DLCs, you can still get exclusive holiday items, if you're up to farm them, which can be a little time consuming. But other than that, all the cars look good, and you can have a lot of cool and goofy styles, if that's your preference.- It's pretty-looking. Honestly, it's one of the prettiest games I've seen (imo), and I play it on the lowest of the lowest quality. I still see the beauty in the maps and how well done some of them are made.- It's fast paced. Now, some people aren't as good with fast paced games, which is why I'm mentioning it. I love me some fast games, but I'm not really sure if this is a pro or a con. It can be discussed.Now, because I've already given the pros, right up there.^ I dunno what else to put in. It's a fun game and a great experience with friends? idfkWell, the only cons I can think of right off the bat is:- The matchmaking system. Some would agree with me, some would be like "BUH SUM PPL HEF ROOKI/VETEREN FRENDS THO". Well y'know what? It's still trash. Honestly. I shouldn't be in a match versus a Veteran when I'm still a Pro. Same with Semi-pro honestly. Yes, the ranks doesn't mean too much, but it can get people on the nerves when they always get a bad team and the other team's much better. Etc. Etc.- It's a sports game. Even though it's not exactly like football (football with cars, wow) it's still football. For those who don't like sports game, or sports in general (except for e-sports) should avoid this. Unless you want to try out something new, that's up to you.- Hitting your own teammates. Yeahm you can hit your own teammates without any consequences, right? Except you can ♥♥♥♥ their position up and lose a point. That's just one example out of many. But I can see how it can be (a little bit) good too. You can hit your teammate in case they got no boost. But usually it just messes up their position.- Easy leveling up. Even though it might not seem like a big deal (levels don't matter) it messes up the matchmaking system, because some Pros and Veterans should play with a lower rank. Again, this can be discussed.Well, I dunno what else to add. For people who don't get the ranking system:- Rookie is the lowest rank, and the first one you'll get. (Level 1-9)- Semi-pro is a rank you get after reaching a certain level. (10-19)- Pro is another rank you'll get after reaching a certain level. (20-29)- Veteran is yet another rank you can get. (30-39)- I'm unsure of the rest of the ranks, but I'm sure there are at least two more. I'm terribly sorry!If I had to rate it though, it'd be 8.5/10. Yeah yeah, sue me, I'm just a human.

content:
Posted: January 29, 2016
A Brief Review of Rocket League: Rocket League is an incredibly fun game based in a future of extreme sport and rocket science!Players operate powerful, rocket powered beasts as they attempt to play a game of football!Games are fun, engaging and extremly enjoyable to play with others. There are many different game modes from 1v1, 2v2, 3v3 and 4v4 as well as other game mades which can apply insanly fun elements such as square footballs, lower gravity or even faster footballs.Apart from the gamemodes themeselves, players have the ability to customise their beastly cars in many different ways from body, wheels, rockets, devals, hats and antennas! The choices for customisation seem almost endless!The incorporation of DLC's also make Rocket League and fun and engaging experience for any player with added cars, maps and even more hats!All in all, for the small price of £15, Rocket League is an extremely fun game for anyone looking for a fun and entertaining experience to enjoy in their free time. This game will recieve 10/10 Mann points for its countless hours of enjoyment, gamemodes and vehicle customisation!

												Played this game for about two months now, and all I can say is I love it. No match is ever the same and there's a ton of different skill levels and ways to play. One thing that annoys me the most however, is the community. Out of EVERY game i've played Rocket League has by far the worst community for lower level players. It's riddled with afk's, people who abandon matches when they're losing, and over all just REALLY toxic people. It does get better the higher level you get and if you're able to get over it for a while, it's not THAT bad. Over all I highly recomend this game for anyone that's looking for a fun new type of mmo. I rate this game a respectable 6/10 for new players. Not that it means anything, it's just my personal rating.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
												I don't like football/soccer, or football/soccer games. I like Rocket League. I can see why people like football/soccer games; the team play, the atmosphere, the tactics and the fun. Rocket League takes these bits and adds Hotwheels cars instead of players. I love it, and my kids love it, which is a rare thing to achieve; to appeal equally to such different age groups. Add to that it is currently the only cross-platform game in the world, allowing PC player to play against/with console players, with no detriment to either formats. Mark my words, this game is incredibly good, and will go down in the annuls of history to be remembered for all time. In the dictionary, under the word "Addictive"(addicting is *not* a word FYI), there is a Rocket League screenshot of the ball exploding after a goal.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												Here is m honest opinion about this game.First, let me tell you about myself. I have played this game for over 160hrs, and i must say, this game is totally awesome.P.S: PROS and CONS below if you want to skip this.About the game: This game is soccer; with cars! Your car has a rocket booster in the back and you can flip your car in all directions, and if you get good at the game, you can even hit the ball in the air [called an aerial] using your rocket booster! [It's not easy to do, but practice makes perfect. P.S: I hit the ball in mid air maybe %10 of the time, which is actually good for my level]. The games are 5 minutes long, which you might think is too quick, but you are totally wrong! The game is perfect with 5 minute games. Of course, if you play privately with friends, you can change the settings to a lot of things like ball size, ball speed, car speed, the timer (5 min, 10 min, 20 min, and unlimited), and a LOT more! The maps are all gorgeous, with great graphics.* The feeling you get when making a goal is the best feeling ever. And when you make a goal that is unexpected, like an aerial goal (scoring a goal while hitting the ball in mid air), its even more amazing. For a person who has $15-$20 on them, and cant make up there mind on a game, they should definetly choose this one, [unless you dont enjoy such a type of game for some (CRAZY) reason].THE PROS:1) Great game over-all.2) The sound in-game is amazing.3) Graphics are amazing.*4) Playing with friends online is just so much fun.5) You can play 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 4v4.6) I personally play with a mouse and keyboard, and i must say, its just as fun if you dont have a controller.7) The plays you can make in-game is just incredible (and pretty hard to do, but easily achieveable)8) And many more*You need a pretty good computer to play this game at max settings.THE CONS:1) The players in-game may get angry when you are winning them (trust me, this is very annoying)2) The talk feature isnt clear, and it is very hard to understand what a person is saying.3) You will need an ok computer to play thisgame, and if your computer is a store-bought one, like an HP, like mine, it will be very laggy when playing in 1920 x 1080 (unless you bought an exeptionally good store-bought computer)4)There is a few more issues i find with the game, however i cant get them off the top of my head at the moment.TIPS TO GET BETTER1) Watch youtube videos, here are a couple of youtubers who are good at the game, and can show you the games true potential: Kronovi, Gibbs, and you will find more on youtube by typing in Rocket League.2) DO THE TRAINING!3) Play around a lot in the free play mode!4) PRACTICE WITH FRIENDS!5) When playing for the first time that day, first play unranked, and if you win a match, then play a ranked match.6) This game isnt about becoming the best, but its mainly about having fun, try to always have that in mind.7) PRACTICE MORE!FINAL NOTES:Just do your bets to enjoy the game, while also playing seriously. The game has updates every so often, and the game just keeps getting better. Hope you enjoyed this review!

content:
Posted: September 13, 2015
												I'm here to tell you all about the positions in Rocket League.Striker:You're job is to score goals and keep the ball on the opponents side.But whatever you do, DON'T MISS A SHOT. You will be hated on until you want to uninstall. If you score a goal, hope you don't have that one guy who spams "What A Save" after every goal. You will get hate.MidField: Most People don't even know that this is a position. You're job is to keep the ball from going too far back. You want to try and set up your Strikers for goals.Unfortunately, the second you miss an Ariel or any hit, you're going to get hate.But it feels so good when you hit an Ariel. So keep calm and waste that boost.Goalie/Keeper:This is probably the most important positions in the game.You're job is to keep the ball out of your net and to clear it up to your midfielders.But be warned, the opponents, and sometimes your own team, will constantly run into you and get in your way.Missing a Save results in a goal and your opponents getting real mad at you. Oh, and don't be that guy who gets the best spawn and stays back. Just don't. Well, that's it. My review on Rocket League. Hopefully this boosts your interest in the game.-Frost.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2016
												This is a game with which I have arguably had the most fun! The controls are easy to get used to, and the action can really build up (I personally enjoy the initial clash after each score the most, as there's no knowing how it will play out)! Not to mention the beautiful soundtrack.This is also one of the few games that I have ever bought so much DLC Content for (Skyrim and South Park: The Stick of Truth are pretty much the only others), because I typically don't like spending the extra money. However, I've yet to come across another game that allows me to geek out like Rocket League does. Come on, where else can you dirve the Official Back to the Future Time-Machine Delorean, or the Bat-Mobile from Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice?Since I bought this game, Psyonix has added Hockey and Hoops as online servers; and as of today (June 20) they're adding Neo Tokyo (and here I am with an addictive sweet-tooth for all things Japanese), along with another arena for Rocket Labs (which I thoroughly enjoy)! I've also purchased another copy of this game to give to a friend since getting this game.I truly hope that Psyonix keeps releasing new content for this game, as it is the Only sports-style game I have ever enjoyed, and will ever play!Oh! Shoutout to #H20Delirious for getting me hooked on Rocket League!

												Now you might be thinking, is Rocket League as good as everyone says it is? Is it worth the hype? I mean after all, isn't it just soccer (footbol) with cars?Rocket League is worth every single word of praise and all the hype it's gotten. It has tons of polish, great music, lots of cosmetics, a great DLC policy (cheap DLC that gives lots of customizations that don't impact gameplay) and it has A DELOREAN TIME MACHINE (DLC, but still).If you're not convinced, Rocket League is one of the most fun multiplayer games known to man. Everything that moves can explode, from the ball to your enemy cars, and now with mutators the action will never get boring.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
												With a total of over 600 hours played I thought it about time to write a review. While this is of course subjective based as is most reviews I hope it provides you with what you are looking for and helps you to decide if you will be purchasing this game.Common thought | Coming from mainly fps and mmo type genres I can't recall a time where I was ever interested in a sport based game in fact I dispised them. I had to be persuaded just like those I have had to persuade before they realise this is a great game that deserves a chance to prove itself. If you are like I was you have probably thrown this game out the window because you think it "looks boring" or "its just soccer with cars" and thats a shame and my goal is to help you reconsider.Match Length |Each match of Rocket League lasts 5 minutes (Custom games excluded). The match ends when the timer hits 0 and the ball hits the ground or a goal is scored. Game Modes | I will start by explaining the non-competitive (Unranked) game modes. I won't go in depth but hope to provide enough information so you get a rough idea of each one. At the time of writing this review there are 8 modes which include: Duel (1v1), Doubles (2v2), Standard (3v3), Chaos (4v4), Snow day (Ice field with a puck instead of a ball), Rocket Labs (Experimental wierd shaped maps), Hoops (Basketball court with the hoops elevated) and Rumble (A new game mode which gives players power ups every 10 seconds which can effect both the ball and other players).I personally prefer Duels and Doubles as they require more effort on my part. Standard is fine and is the most common in the pro scene however I am not a fan of that many cars on the field at one time and usually stay in goals to avoid the mayhem. 4v4 is just a cluster ♥♥♥♥ and I never play it. Snow day was fun for about 5 minutes but not something I will be going back to. Rocket Labs can be fun for some random games and provides variation from the standard maps. Hoops was also fun for about 5 minutes and I feel the court is to small and should be made larger or even the same size as the soccer field but that might come across as wierd since a basketball court is smaller then a soccer field... anyway I don't play it and won't play it again. Rumble suprised me actually. It's quite fun and its hard to predict what can happen. You opponant may shoot for goal but then the ball is frozen in mid air for a few seconds which is then saved followed by a punch which sends the ball to the other end. I will be going to Rumble when I want some variation to my game from time to time.Competitive |This is where the game gets fun however does have both pros and cons. The competitive (Ranked) game modes include Duel, Doubles, Standard and Solo Standard (3's but you queue by yourself). Ranks - A total of 10 matches are required before you will be placed into a rank. There are 4 tiers which include Prospect (Prospect 1,2,3 & Elite), Challenger (Challenger 1,2,3 & Elite), Star (Rising Star, Shooting Star, All Star & Super Star) Champion (Champion, Super Champion & Grand Champion) Each rank within a tier has 5 divisions. Once you have reached division 5 in that rank you then have a chance to move up 1 rank. PROS:1. Its hard! - Games that are easy are boring, Rocket League is a game that you progressively improve over time and there are always players at your level which means you don't always get owned. When you score a goal or win its satisfying. After 600 hours when I get a goal it still feels awesome. 2. Teamwork and Communication - Strategy is definitely something that will improve you game. Pulling off mad plays or passing at the right time then stepping our opponant to score a goal is cool as ♥♥♥♥!CONS:1. sometimes versing unfair opponants where you verse someone greatly better then yourself or a smurf which is incredibly irritating.2. The addition of the Wasteland and Tokyo maps in competitive play. I feel they shouldn't be included as the field is different then the rest of the standard maps. This means some people may get these maps more then others which I feel is unfair. Tokyo being in competitive takes it to another level. The map has elevated sides and is just rediculous. Wasteland and Tokyo should be in non competive only.Final Thought |Look the game isn't easy, it takes time to get good and a very long time to get great but don't automatically disregard the game as♥♥♥♥♥♥before you play it thats just being naive. I've read some of the negative comments on steam for Rocket League and they are a perfect example. I understand the game isn't for everyone but what I am saying is it is worth trying if you don't like it refund it. I could have continued this review and I am sure I could have written it better I haven't written many reviews. if I can update it I will later but I hope that this helps.

content:
Posted: August 30, 2015
												Rocket League is a simple concept executed very very well. If the idea of playing soccer with nitro-boosted cars sounds fun to you, then you'll probably enjoy this game. It's a lot of fun with friends, but it's also fun going solo and grouping up with random teams. The presentation is top notch. The menus are intuitive and easy to navigate. There is a tutorial mode to help you figure out the basic moves of the game. The game plays really well (as in the controls are good). The camera can take some getting used to, but it's fine. The menu soundtrack is amazing. That's a small detail but it just shows you that Psyonix really thought about each part of the game. Definitely recommended, especially with friends.Update: This is now my most played game on Steam. It's a lot of fun and Psyonix is always updating the game, whether adding DLC (it's just cosmetic stuff... different looking cars, wheels, paint, accessories, etc... you don't need to buy any of it unless you just want to) or additional modes or holiday-themed limited time items. They added a mutator mode for a while which was a lot of fun, a hockey mode for the winter, and now they've added non-standard shaped arenas in the rocket labs mode. This provides for a fresh experience as the game changes things up every now and then.TL;DR - This game is really fun. Grab it. ;)

content:
Posted: October 13, 2015
												Addicted!  I used to play a game called Monster Truck Madness 64 on the Nintendo 64 where you could play soccer and hockey with monster trucks.  The mechanics were obviously what you'd expect from an N64 game, but it was fun.  This game took it to a whole new level.I love the competitiveness in the game.  I like that you can cross play with PS4 players (although I wish you could party with PS4 players).  Controller support is great!  I have a lot of friends that play the game.One thing I think they could really work on is the lag compensation.  There can be really bad rubberbanding if there is lag.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2015
												Best.Game.Ever.**Edit**With almost 200 hours into this game my love for it is has not in any way dimished.I feel like i reached my peak about 195 hours ago, i can manage to pull off insane goal after goal and pretty feel and look like some kind of expert.  Then the very next game (sometimes the same one!) i can barely hit anything and am made to look like the s**t player i am!  But this rollarcoaster is what make this game so exciting to play, and the feeling when you score that backwards aeriel goal is worth a hunded flapping misses as the ball slowly slides pass you into your goal...Plus if by chance you ever did start to feel tired of the format (this hasn't happened to me as yet) then the devs bring out a new game mode so i can show miss and swear, but at leats blame the "new" format for it!I guess the only negative is some of the players attitudes, but then its online gaming and where isn't there an a problem with a small amount of other players and their incessant need for attention, negative or otherwise!This is almost certainly a game that will never get "put down" or if it does its because my thumbs and fingers have given up on life and they haven't invented some sort of head bobbing eye movment mode so i can keep missing then scoring amazing goals all in one game!

content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
												With a total of over 600 hours played I thought it about time to write a review. While this is of course subjective based as is most reviews I hope it provides you with what you are looking for and helps you to decide if you will be purchasing this game.Common thought | Coming from mainly fps and mmo type genres I can't recall a time where I was ever interested in a sport based game in fact I dispised them. I had to be persuaded just like those I have had to persuade before they realise this is a great game that deserves a chance to prove itself. If you are like I was you have probably thrown this game out the window because you think it "looks boring" or "its just soccer with cars" and thats a shame and my goal is to help you reconsider.Match Length |Each match of Rocket League lasts 5 minutes (Custom games excluded). The match ends when the timer hits 0 and the ball hits the ground or a goal is scored. Game Modes | I will start by explaining the non-competitive (Unranked) game modes. I won't go in depth but hope to provide enough information so you get a rough idea of each one. At the time of writing this review there are 8 modes which include: Duel (1v1), Doubles (2v2), Standard (3v3), Chaos (4v4), Snow day (Ice field with a puck instead of a ball), Rocket Labs (Experimental wierd shaped maps), Hoops (Basketball court with the hoops elevated) and Rumble (A new game mode which gives players power ups every 10 seconds which can effect both the ball and other players).I personally prefer Duels and Doubles as they require more effort on my part. Standard is fine and is the most common in the pro scene however I am not a fan of that many cars on the field at one time and usually stay in goals to avoid the mayhem. 4v4 is just a cluster ♥♥♥♥ and I never play it. Snow day was fun for about 5 minutes but not something I will be going back to. Rocket Labs can be fun for some random games and provides variation from the standard maps. Hoops was also fun for about 5 minutes and I feel the court is to small and should be made larger or even the same size as the soccer field but that might come across as wierd since a basketball court is smaller then a soccer field... anyway I don't play it and won't play it again. Rumble suprised me actually. It's quite fun and its hard to predict what can happen. You opponant may shoot for goal but then the ball is frozen in mid air for a few seconds which is then saved followed by a punch which sends the ball to the other end. I will be going to Rumble when I want some variation to my game from time to time.Competitive |This is where the game gets fun however does have both pros and cons. The competitive (Ranked) game modes include Duel, Doubles, Standard and Solo Standard (3's but you queue by yourself). Ranks - A total of 10 matches are required before you will be placed into a rank. There are 4 tiers which include Prospect (Prospect 1,2,3 & Elite), Challenger (Challenger 1,2,3 & Elite), Star (Rising Star, Shooting Star, All Star & Super Star) Champion (Champion, Super Champion & Grand Champion) Each rank within a tier has 5 divisions. Once you have reached division 5 in that rank you then have a chance to move up 1 rank. PROS:1. Its hard! - Games that are easy are boring, Rocket League is a game that you progressively improve over time and there are always players at your level which means you don't always get owned. When you score a goal or win its satisfying. After 600 hours when I get a goal it still feels awesome. 2. Teamwork and Communication - Strategy is definitely something that will improve you game. Pulling off mad plays or passing at the right time then stepping our opponant to score a goal is cool as ♥♥♥♥!CONS:1. sometimes versing unfair opponants where you verse someone greatly better then yourself or a smurf which is incredibly irritating.2. The addition of the Wasteland and Tokyo maps in competitive play. I feel they shouldn't be included as the field is different then the rest of the standard maps. This means some people may get these maps more then others which I feel is unfair. Tokyo being in competitive takes it to another level. The map has elevated sides and is just rediculous. Wasteland and Tokyo should be in non competive only.Final Thought |Look the game isn't easy, it takes time to get good and a very long time to get great but don't automatically disregard the game as♥♥♥♥♥♥before you play it thats just being naive. I've read some of the negative comments on steam for Rocket League and they are a perfect example. I understand the game isn't for everyone but what I am saying is it is worth trying if you don't like it refund it. I could have continued this review and I am sure I could have written it better I haven't written many reviews. if I can update it I will later but I hope that this helps.

												This is a brilliant game, and it has the perfect micro-transaction model as the items you get from the crates are not pay to win, and are instead cosmetic. In addition, the update has established an economy for rocket league, so you can trade others crates for keys, meaning you don't even need to pay to get keys. In addition, all non-decal items in crates are worth >1 key, so there is a large possibility to make back your investment.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2015
												Psyonix is the BEST developer ever. The game is only $20 to begin with. The DLC are like $3 each and are COMPLETELY optional. The cars added through DLC are just cosmetic and give the players no advantage over others who dont have the DLC (AKA super balanced gameplay). Overall the gameplay is easy to learn YET VERY HARD TO MASTER. This game is super addictive and I can't see myself putting it down in the foreseeable future. My friends and I are moving up through the ranked leagues and although it may seem like a grind, every match is enjoyable. The car customization, cross platform play, splitscreen multiplayer, mutators, and frequent updates are some added benefits that make this game great.Must have game IMO.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
												This is probably one of the best and most addictive multiplayer games i've played in the last few years. The premise is simple. Its rocket powered cars playing football and its as fun and manic as it sounds. The matches take place in a big boxed in arena (yes you can drive up the walls and even on the roof) with the options of 1v1, 2v2, 3v3 and 4v4 in both ranked and unranked matches (though 4v4 is not available in ranked). I'd strongly recommend a controller as well for this game.Good points:- given the premise of this game its very easy to get into but difficult to master. It requires a lot of skill to be a great player but regardless of how skillful you are, you can still have a lot of fun with this game. -This is the first cross platform multiplayer game i've played as ts possible to play against PS4 players as well as PC which is good as theres more likely to be enough players online that you wont have to wait ages to join a game.-with the matches being only around 5 minutes long its a great game to jump in and out of to kill a few mintes.-it has a great replay feature that allows you to save replays of entire matches to view again or for recording purposes.Bad points:-the servers can be a bit laggy at times and though not as bad as the it was around release it still is a problem at times.tl:dr this game has given me some of the most thrilling multiplayer experiences i've had. The feeling of grabbing a late goal to win a tight match is incredible or the devastating feeling of losing after conceding a last second goal is just something that not a lot of other games have managed to do for me. An absolute must buy.

												Now you might be thinking, is Rocket League as good as everyone says it is? Is it worth the hype? I mean after all, isn't it just soccer (footbol) with cars?Rocket League is worth every single word of praise and all the hype it's gotten. It has tons of polish, great music, lots of cosmetics, a great DLC policy (cheap DLC that gives lots of customizations that don't impact gameplay) and it has A DELOREAN TIME MACHINE (DLC, but still).If you're not convinced, Rocket League is one of the most fun multiplayer games known to man. Everything that moves can explode, from the ball to your enemy cars, and now with mutators the action will never get boring.
